author: terencechain
content: Hi <@199561711278227457> does devnet5 have tracoor? I want to download a state

author: potuz
content:
<@199561711278227457> how expensive would be to run a single node long running devnet 
- mainnet distribution
- small validator set
- transaction fuzzer on constantly
- consensus fuzzer ran sporadically.
- stable mainnet versions of all clients. 

I assume the most expensive part is human capital here

author: potuz
content: It wouldn't have caught Prysm's consensus splitting bug in devnet 5 but it would catch scarier live ones

author: parithosh
content: With how many validators? If it's a low enough number then the cost isn't high at all, other than some upkeep that can probably be automated

author: potuz
content: Minimum possible, idea is to use it as an active differential fuzzer rather than a stress testing tool

author: parithosh
content: Yeah that shouldn't be too expensive and manageable, I can scope it out and text you the details. Sophia was potentially looking at a large gas limit devnet, perhaps that can be integrated here as well.

author: parithosh
content:
Prysm fix has been deployed, so participation rate in pectra-devnet-5 should slowly move up.

Here are the latest hive run results: https://hive.ethpandaops.io/pectra-devnet-5/

There are some new failures due to invalid params, it would be great if the ELs could investigate and patch the issues. 

In the meantime, please start planning for pectra-devnet-6. A spec page will be up by morning. There are two major changes:
- We will have a EEST release, tracker found here: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/issues/1108
- The `blobGasPriceUpdateFraction` will be in all genesis files, please ensure your EL can handle reading it
